summarize this construction opportunity 
**Project Title:** Gettysburg/Norwich Alley Reconstruction  
  
**Invitation #:** CIP 19-15

91314 - Paving/Resurfacing Alley & Parking Lot

**Scope of Services:** The work shall include, but not be limited to, reconstruction of the Gettysburg/Norwich Alley, from Villa Avenue to Gettysburg Avenue, including constructing a valley gutter, drive approaches, and adjusting utilities to grade.  
  
**Other Details:**   
  
**Special Notices:**   
  
**Pre-Bid Meeting:** No  
  
**Pre-Bid Meeting Date:**   
  
**Pre-Bid Meeting Location:**

This is an invitation for bids for the Gettysburg/Norwich Alley Reconstruction project (CIP 19-15) in Fresno County, California. The project involves reconstructing the alley from Villa Avenue to Gettysburg Avenue, including constructing a valley gutter, drive approaches, and adjusting utilities to grade. The bid due date is November 1, 2022, and the project is a lump-sum award for categories including road and highway building materials, paving/resurfacing alley and parking lot, construction parking lot and alley, and paving/resurfacing alley and parking lot. There is no estimated bid value, and there is no pre-bid meeting or online Q&A.

This construction opportunity is for the Roadway Widening and Reconstruction in Montgomery County, New York. The project includes providing all labor, materials, machinery, tools, equipment, and other means of construction necessary to complete the work shown on the plans and described in the specifications. The due date for the submission of quotes is 02/23/2023 at 2:00 PM. The primary contact for this project is Jaclyn Hernigle, the Purchasing Agent for Montgomery County.

The opportunity involves roadway widening and reconstruction in Montgomery County, New York. The work requires providing labor, materials, machinery, equipment, and other means of construction necessary to complete the project. The due date for bids is February 23, 2023, at 2:00 PM. The contract term is not specified. The opportunity is not a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Set Aside. The technical contact for the project is Chris Cornwell, Project Manager at GPI. The primary contact for the project is Jaclyn Hernigle, Purchasing Agent for Montgomery County. No substantially similar contracts have been awarded in the past five years.
